Articles.Content:
I am looking for a mod that will show me the ejection angle when I hover the mouse over a point on my orbit. I don't want a bunch of extra junk with it, so if one actually exists that has extra crap I'm hoping it's open source so I can just rip out what I don't want.

If such a mod doesn't exist is it technically possible to write one that will work without having some sort of custom part on the ship (it's annoying as hell)? If so, can someone point me to a tutorial or open source mod that I can look at as a starting point?

Thanks!

A custom part is useful because you can easily have the mod just on the stages and ships where it's needed rather than being accessible all of the time time.

There's very little difference in functionality so generally anything that can be done with a custom part can be done with a KSPAddon that runs on it's own with a few changes in how it detects stuff.

You could have a look at the protractor mod, that calculates ejection angles for the current position in orbit.

Edited July 2, 2013 by EndlessWaves

The Lazor also does this sort of thing as far as I'm aware. It has a bunch of extra junk with it, but is open As an alternative to the (recommended) KSPAddon method of partless plugins, there is still the old method of using the unit testing interface. See here for details.

I wanted to avoid having a custom part because this is a simple GUI overlay that I want at all times and having to strap an extra part to every rocket is very annoying, although I do see the point you're making.

Thanks for the links, pizzaoverhead, I was also not aware that Lazor did that.

I am looking into this mainly for personal use and to get started with mod writing. (Sorry for the lack of quotes, copy-pasta is a pain on a phone.)
